desc: GATA1 encodes for the gene GATA binding protein 1 that acts as a transcription factor (PMID:1987478). GATA1 activates many critical genes involved in erythroid and megakaryocyte development (PMID:7568185, 7823932), including the beta globin gene and erythropoietin receptor (PMID:1924329, 1660143). Germline mutation in GATA1 is associated with anemia, thrombocytopenia and porphyria (PMID:10700180, 11675338, 16783379, 17148589). Mutation in GATA1 and reduced translation of GATA1 can also lead to Diamond Blackfan anemia (PMID:24952648). The gene is located on the X-chromosome, and thus associated diseases are sex-linked disorders. In patients with Down Syndrome, mutations in GATA1 are observed with acute megakaryocytic leukemia development and transient myeloid disorders (PMID:12172547, 12747884). In solid tumors, select studies suggest GATA1 can regulate tumor aggressiveness and DNA repair (PMID:20101202, 17332341,25230694).

desc: GATA1 encodes a transcription factor involved in red blood cell and platelet development. Somatic mutations of GATA1 are found in leukemias.
